bwwExcerpt: I will just say that after a disconcerting but all-too-believable set of revelations that up the ante of satire into something far more cutting and unsettling, the play oversteps the edge and pushes everything beyond the pale into the realm of the otherworldly. Yet, while I cannot think of that tacked on 'tour de force' ending as anything other than an overreaching mistake, pretty much everything that comes before, including an 'historical reenactment,' carefully choreographed by the Ojibwe and Oneida performance artist Ty Defoe, makes The Minutes a thrill ride of dark, dark comedy and a highlight of the theater season.
showScoreExcerpt:
"A literal and metaphoric storm rocks an otherwise seemingly unremarkable city council meeting in the Steppenwolf Theatre Company's production of Tracy Letts's 'The Minutes' ... in an amalgam of tone and style that roils from gentle satire to sobering reality to a truly WTF ending that belongs to another genre altogether."
